title: S&P 500 Q1 earnings estimated growth improves; stocks up for week
content: U.S. first-quarter estimated earnings growth is looking stronger at nearly the halfway mark of the reporting period, with corporate results giving a boost to stocks this week after recent weakness.  S&P 500 year-over-year earnings growth for the first quarter of 2024 is now seen at 5.6%, according to LSEG data on Friday.  The latest estimate is based on results from 229 of the S&P 500 companies and forecasts for the rest, with about 78% of reports beating analysts' earnings expectations.

title: ABT, DHR, DXCM: Which “Strong Buy” Healthcare Stock Has More Upside?
